page.title: 05DALLINGTON WINDMILL
page.content: The Dallington windmill was built in 1851/2 for Mr Albert Geering.It was a white fantail smockmill.It was in a field just 200 yards northeast of the village church.The land was leased from the Ashburnham Estate,and Upfields of Warbleton were employed to erect the white wooden smock on a tarred two_storey brick base.A sale notice in the Sussex weekly Advertiser for 2nd of August 1881 gives this as "An exceedingly well built smock mill situated near Dallington Street".It is in good order and condition,built of the best materials driving two pairs of stones,fitted with a grain cracking mill,the usual machinery,and has patent sweeps plus brick and tile stables for three horses and a van lodge.Sometime during late 1913,the smock was pulled down leaving the base and buildings standing.
